place.name: MAESMYNYS
place.gazetteerText: MAES-MYNIS, a parish in Builth district, Brecon; between the rivers Irvon and Donhiw, 1 mile SW of Builth town and r. station. It contains the village of Nantyrarian; and its Post town is Builth, Breconshire. Acres, 4,012. Real property, £1,328. Pop., 239. Houses, 42. The liVing is a rectory in the diocese of St. David's. Value, £128. * Patron, the Bishop of St. David's. The church is ancient, and has an old font. Charities, £8. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
